(Associated Press) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) â€” The Latest on a deadly mass shooting at a video game tournament in Jacksonville, Florida (all times local): NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 10:15 a.m. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A gaming rival of the former gaming champion suspected of killing two competitors, wounding nine others and killing himself recalled him as "being kind of different." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Shane Kivlen was the best friend of one of the gamers who was killed in Sunday's shooting at Jacksonville Landing in Florida. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kivlen tells The Associated Press that 24-year-old David Katz didn't talk much with fellow gamers, either online or when they met face-to-face for Madden tournaments. He says much of what he and others knew of Katz, they learned from his baffling style of playing the game. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kivlen says Katz was smart, "but something was off about him." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He says Katz wasn't known to trash talk with rivals. But after winning a championship last year, Kivlen says Katz "got up and let out the weirdest scream ever." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kivlen was at his Jacksonville hotel when the shooting happened Sunday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ___ NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 12:40 a.m. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Authorities say a gunman opened-fire at an online video game tournament in Florida, killing two people before fatally shooting himself as a livestream of the event appeared to capture gunfire, shouts and screams. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said at a news conference after the rampage Sunday afternoon that nine other people were wounded by gunfire and two others had been hurt in the chaos as people sought to flee. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He said authorities believe 24-year-old David Katz of Baltimore carried out the attack with at least one handgun at the Jacksonville Landing, a complex of eateries and shops on the St. Johns River in that north Florida city.
